thread.title: Prep roundup: Morton soccer caps regular season with win
thread.title_full: Prep roundup: Morton soccer caps regular season with win

title: Prep roundup: Morton soccer caps regular season with win
text:
Prep roundup: Morton soccer caps regular season with win Published: Tuesday, Oct. 20, 2015 12:51 p.m. CDT Caption (Lorae Mundt for Shaw Media) Christian Tovar gets his head on the ball Oct. 10 in a game against Leyden. The Mustangs topped Riverside Brookfield in the regular-season finale Oct. 14. By SUBURBAN LIFE MEDIA 
Morton’s boys soccer team capped the regular season with a 6-0 win against Riverside Brookfield on Oct. 14 before starting postseason play Oct. 20. 
GIRLS CROSS COUNTRY 
Morton 
Sahian Lopez finished fifth with a time of 18:46 to lead the Mustangs at the West Suburban Gold meet Oct. 17. 
Lia Rucci, Natalie Garcia, Salma Rodriguez, Sabrina Aleman, Sandy Barrientos and Annette Sanchez finished in succession with Rucci placing 18th. Morton was third as a team. 
BOYS CROSS COUNTRY 
Morton 
Eduardo Martinez (seventh, 15:40) had a top-10 finish to lead the way at the West Suburban Gold meet Oct. 17. 
Armando Arreola, Jorge Rodriguez, Rafael Ibarra and Dan Delgado were scoring runners for the Mustangs, while Nathan Morelly and Armando Rodriguez ran strong races as Morton was third as a team. 
FOOTBALL 
Nazareth 
Two Ivory Kelly-Martin touchdown runs in the first quarter gave Nazareth’s football team an early boost and plenty of momentum in a 62-45 win against Marist on Oct. 16. 
Julian Love had an 11-yard touchdown run in the first quarter as the Roadrunners (6-2 overall, 4-2 East Suburban Catholic Conference) led 21-10 entering the second quarter. 
Another Kelly-Martin score and Joe Muscolino’s 1-yard touchdown run put Naz ahead 34-10 at halftime, and the lead swelled to 62-31 after Love’s 32-yard touchdown run in the fourth quarter. 
Kelly-Martin rushed for 238 yards and five touchdowns, while Love had 92 yards and two touchdowns. 
The win ensured a playoff berth for Nazareth, which closes the regular season Oct. 23 at St. Viator. 
Fenwick 
Will Lattner hauled in a 2-yard touchdown pass from Jacob Keller to open the scoring Oct. 17 in a game against Montini, but it was all Broncos after that in a 48-7 loss for the Friars. 
The loss dropped Fenwick’s record to 3-5 before the regular-season finale at St. Francis on Oct. 23. 
GIRLS TENNIS 
Morton 
The Mustangs scored eight points to finish fifth at the Lyons Township sectional. They did not have any state qualifiers.
